intro: Callistanthos travassosii, commonly known as the Travassos's chia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, adapted to withstand dry conditions. It produces small, round seeds that are often used in traditional culinary practices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
